roundDescription: (8 points) The first answer in this round will start with "D-O," the second with "R-E," then "M-I," and so forth.

questions.questionText: "Dalek," "TARDIS," and "Sonic screwdriver" are all in the Oxford English Dictionary thanks to what sci-fi show?
"The six-week cure" was 1950s slang for briefly moving to what Nevada city to secure a divorce?
Like an even worse "Blood and Honey," the 2024 horror film "The Mouse Trap" uses the no-longer-copyrighted Steamboat Willie version of what character?
Mark Shakman went out to the desert to find rocks to use as a model for The Thing, for his upcoming film about what super quartet?
Though it doesn't sound all that wise, what baby-dividing Biblical king supposedly had 700 wives?
The ATMs in Vatican City cheekily give their instructions in what language that's still sort of alive there?
Bad Bunny's aunt asks him whether he has a bunch of girlfriends, in what 2022 Spanish-language song?
A cave painting with the oldest known depiction of people swimming has them doing what canine-inspired stroke?
Bonus: After establishing his superhero cred with three "Spider-Man" films, "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness" was the first MCU film for Sam WHO?
